greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse Euler transform of A280611.
comment: a(n) = b(n) for n odd, a(n) = b(n) - b(n/2) for n even >= 2, where b(n) = A014197(n) = the number of m with phi(m) = n.
Note that a(n) = 0 for all odd n > 1, and so a(n) = b(n) for n >= 3, n not a multiple of 4.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20160
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
formula: Euler transform of sequence = Product_{k>=1} (1-x^k)^(-a(k)) is the g.f. of A280611.
program: A014197(n, m=1) = { n==1 && return(1+(m<2)); my(p, q); sumdiv(n, d, if( d>=m && isprime(d+1), sum( i=0, valuation(q=n\d, p=d+1), A014197(q\p^i, p))))}; \\ From A014197
results.author: _Christopher J. Smyth_, Jan 07 2017
